Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Jonesville -- 1% S&U - M&BOA - 9 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Town of Jonesville, State of Louisiana (the "Town"), under the provisions of Act No. 339 of the 2015 Regular Session of the Louisiana Legislature (the "Act"), and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to levy and collect a tax of one percent (1%) (the "Tax") upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the Town, all as defined by law (an estimated $360,000 reasonably expected to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for a period of nine (9) years, commencing April 1, 2016, with the avails and proceeds of the Tax (after paying reasonable and necessary costs and expenses of collecting and administering the Tax) received by the Town to be used for the purpose of hardsurfacing, rehabilitation, and resurfacing of the streets located within the corporate limits of the Town?
